SEARCH
Package com.huerta.fleetmanagementsystem.model.vehicle

Class Vehicle

java.lang.Object
com.huerta.fleetmanagementsystem.model.vehicle.Vehicle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Assignable, Calculable, Maintainable, Reportable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Car, HeavyVehicle, Motorcycle
public abstract class Vehicle extends Object implements Assignable, Calculable, Maintainable, Reportable
Abstract base class for every vehicle in the fleet.

OOP concept – Abstraction: Vehicle is declared abstract and cannot be instantiated directly. It defines common state and behaviour, while forcing subclasses to provide a concrete calculateOperatingCost() implementation.

OOP concept – Hierarchy (Inheritance): concrete types (Car, Motorcycle) extend Vehicle directly, while HeavyVehicle introduces an intermediate layer for weight-related concerns, further extended by Bus and Truck.

OOP concept – Polymorphism: methods such as calculateOperatingCost(), generateReport() and calculateDepreciation() are dispatched dynamically at runtime depending on the actual subclass.

OOP concept – Composition: a vehicle owns its Engine, Transmission and BreakingSystem components — they are created in the constructor and share the vehicle’s lifecycle.

OOP concept – Encapsulation: all fields are private with validated setters; getters are generated by Lombok (@Getter).

OOP concept – Upcasting: any concrete vehicle (e.g. new Car(...)) can be stored as a Vehicle reference, enabling polymorphic collections such as List<Vehicle>.

See Also:
  • HeavyVehicle
  • Car
  • Motorcycle

  • Constructor Details

    • Vehicle

      public Vehicle()
      Default no-arg constructor.

    • Vehicle

      public Vehicle(long id, String licensePlate, String make, String model, int year, double mileage)
      Creates a vehicle with the given identity and basic attributes. Component objects (Engine, Transmission, BreakingSystem) are instantiated here (composition).
      Parameters:
      id - unique identifier (≥ 0)
      licensePlate - licence plate; must not be blank
      make - manufacturer; must not be blank
      model - model name; must not be blank
      year - manufacturing year (1886–next year)
      mileage - total kilometres (≥ 0)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is invalid

    • calculateDepreciation

      public double calculateDepreciation()
      Calculates the depreciation factor of this object based on age and usage.

      Formula: 10 % per year of age + 1 % per 10 000 km, capped at 90 %.

      Specified by:
      calculateDepreciation in interface Calculable
      Returns:
      a value between 0.0 (no depreciation) and 0.90 (maximum depreciation cap)

    • calculateOperatingCost

      public abstract double calculateOperatingCost()
      Calculates the operating cost specific to this vehicle type.

      OOP concept – Polymorphism: each concrete subclass provides its own formula; the JVM selects the correct implementation at runtime via dynamic dispatch.

      Specified by:
      calculateOperatingCost in interface Calculable
      Returns:
      operating cost in monetary units
